issue.title: Optimize the build [ECR-534]:

labels.name: Next to merge :flight_arrival:
labels.description: The next PR to merge (that is up-to-date with master)

repository.name: exonum-java-binding
repository.description: Java Binding for the Exonum blockchain framework

issue.body:
## Overview

- Profile the build with various options (see the results in Jira :arrow_down_small: )
- Add Maven JVM configuration files that improve the build time, according to the experiments
- Make all tests parallel-execution friendly. The remaining issues are:
  - TestkitExtension can't work with `@Nested` tests. 
    Already fixed in master, scheduled to 5.5.
    See https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/issues/1925
  - MockitoExtension does not work in parallel.
- Enable parallel builds and parallel tests on CI. 
  @dip56 have already stress-tested them to be reliable enough.
- Document how this can be enabled locally.

<!-- Please describe your changes here and list any open questions you might have. -->

---
See: https://jira.bf.local/browse/ECR-534

### Definition of Done

- [x] There are no TODOs left in the code
- [x] Change is covered by automated [tests](https://github.com/exonum/exonum-java-binding/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#tests)
- [x] The [coding guidelines](https://github.com/exonum/exonum-java-binding/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#the-code-style) are followed
- [x] Public API has Javadoc
- [x] Method preconditions are checked and documented in the Javadoc of the method
- [x] Changelog is updated if needed (in case of notable or breaking changes)
- [x] The continuous integration build passes

body: Tentatively slated for 5.6 M1 for _team discussion_
What happens if you annotate the top-level test class with `@TestInstance(PER_CLASS)`?
It will suppress the parallel execution, and all tests will be run in the same thread and pass. If I also add `@Execution(ExecutionMode.CONCURRENT)`, they also pass.

The extension instance in both cases will be, predictably, the same: 

```
[INFO] Running dt.TestExtensionTest
repetition 1 of 10 in tid = 20, extension = dt.TestExtension@267728db
t2(String) in tid = 17, extension = dt.TestExtension@267728db
repetition 3 of 10 in tid = 22, extension = dt.TestExtension@267728db
repetition 5 of 10 in tid = 23, extension = dt.TestExtension@267728db
repetition 4 of 10 in tid = 21, extension = dt.TestExtension@267728db
nestedT1() in tid = 15, extension = dt.TestExtension@267728db
t3(String) in tid = 19, extension = dt.TestExtension@267728db
repetition 2 of 10 in tid = 18, extension = dt.TestExtension@267728db
repetition 6 of 10 in tid = 18, extension = dt.TestExtension@267728db
repetition 7 of 10 in tid = 22, extension = dt.TestExtension@267728db
repetition 9 of 10 in tid = 20, extension = dt.TestExtension@267728db
repetition 8 of 10 in tid = 17, extension = dt.TestExtension@267728db
repetition 10 of 10 in tid = 15, extension = dt.TestExtension@267728db
```

issue.title: Prune Release Notes for 5.5

milestone.title: 5.5 GA
milestone.description: Themes: declarative `@Timeout` support, new `InvocationInterceptor` and `LifecycleMethodExecutionExceptionHandler` extension APIs, deprecation of script-based conditions (`@EnabledIf` and `@DisabledIf`), configurable test discovery implementation for `TestEngine` authors, explicit Java module descriptors, various minor improvements and bug fixes

body: @dmitry-timofeev Thanks for reporting this bug! Looks like it was around since we introduced `@RegisterExtension`.
@marcphilipp Thank you very much for the fix!
